title: Highest Average Precipitation
description: Colombia experiences an average precipitation of 3240 mm per year, making it one of the wettest countries globally as of 2021.

title: Significant IMF Financial Flows
description: In 2020, Colombia received net financial flows from the IMF amounting to $5.22 billion, indicating substantial international financial engagement.

title: Robust Business Entry Regulations
description: Colombia scored 96.61 in the Business Entry Pillar for quality regulations in 2024, reflecting a strong regulatory environment for new businesses.

title: High Demand for Family Planning Satisfaction
description: In 2015, 86.4% of married women in Colombia had their demand for family planning satisfied by modern methods, showcasing effective family planning services.

title: High Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: As of 2015, 15.23% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, highlighting a significant child labor issue.

title: Substantial Interest Payments
description: Colombia's interest payments reached 69.63 trillion LCU in 2023, indicating a significant financial burden on the national budget.

title: High Number of Surgical Procedures
description: In 2015, Colombia performed 27,385 surgical procedures per 100,000 population, reflecting a well-developed healthcare system.

title: Extensive Child Self-Employment
description: In 2015, 15.39% of children aged 7-14 were self-employed, indicating a high level of child labor in informal sectors.

title: Lowest Net Investment in Nonfinancial Assets
description: In 2016, Colombia recorded a net investment in nonfinancial assets of -4,257,815,123,537 LCU, indicating a significant disinvestment in this sector.

title: Minimal Changes in Inventories
description: As of 2023, Colombia's changes in inventories stood at -59,417,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting a substantial reduction in stock levels.

title: Limited Unemployment Benefits Coverage
description: In 2022, only 14.57% of Colombia's population was covered by unemployment benefits and active labor market programs, highlighting a gap in social protection.

title: Low Social Safety Net Adequacy
description: The adequacy of social safety net programs in Colombia was 69.11% of the total welfare of beneficiary households in 2022, indicating room for improvement.

title: Minimal Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, only 3.1% of Colombian women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for any reason, reflecting a low societal acceptance of domestic violence.
